revised_title: Observations on the Human Spleen and Thigh-Bone Fractures
tldr: This article discusses two medical observations made by J. Douglass. The first observation is about the glands visible in the human spleen, which the author believes are distinct glands. The second observation is about a thigh-bone fracture, which the author corrects as a common mistake among surgeons. The author also mentions the strength of muscles and ligaments surrounding the joint and the vulnerability of the bone's neck.
scientific_discipline: Medicine and Health Sciences > Anatomy and Pathology
